qas.question: What area continued to exist after Londinium was abandoned following the end of Roman rule?
What was responsible for the decline of the Anglo-Saxon settlement of Lundenwic?
How many known attacks on London did the Vikings commit?
By the late 7th century, what was a main function of Lundenwic?
Of the three recorded Viking assaults on London, how many were successful?

context: With the collapse of Roman rule in the early 5th century, London ceased to be a capital and the walled city of Londinium was effectively abandoned, although Roman civilisation continued in the <a0_0>St Martin-in-the-Fields<a0_0/> area until around 450. From around 500, an Anglo-Saxon settlement known as Lundenwic developed in the same area, slightly to the west of the old Roman city. By about 680, it had revived sufficiently to become <a3_0>a major port<a3_0/>, although there is little evidence of large-scale production of goods. From the 820s the town declined because of <a1_0>repeated Viking invasions<a1_0/>. There are <a2_0>three<a2_0/> recorded Viking assaults on London; <a4_0>two<a4_0/> of which were successful in 851 and 886 AD, although they were defeated during the attack of 994 AD.
